DataElement.preferredName: Person Penicillin Antibiotic Hypersensitivity Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether a person has had a local or general reaction following contact with any beta-lactam antibiotic derived from Pencillium fungi with bactericidal activity to which the person has been previously exposed and to which it has become sensitized, as an elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Penicillin Antibiotic Hypersensitivity Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a person having a local or general reaction following contact with any beta-lactam antibiotic derived from Pencillium fungi with bactericidal activity to which the person has been previously exposed and to which it has become sensitized, as an elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Property.preferredName: Penicillin Antibiotic Hypersensitivity Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: An antibiotic drug used to treat infection.:A local or general reaction of an organism following contact with a specific allergen to which it has been previously exposed and to which it has become sensitized.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: Any beta-lactam antibiotic derived from Penicillium fungi with bactericidal activity. Penicillin antibiotics bind to and inactivate penicillin-binding proteins (PBPs) located on the inner membrane of the bacterial cell wall. Inactivation of PBPs interferes with the cross-linkage of peptidoglycan chains necessary for bacterial cell wall strength and rigidity. This interrupts bacterial cell wall synthesis and results in the weakening of the bacterial cell wall, eventually causing cell lysis.
An immune response that occurs following exposure to an innocuous antigen, but that does not require the presence of preformed antibodies to the antigen.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
